title: What is a plasma membrane? - Quora

response.answer_text: Plasma membrane is a microscopic membrane of lipids and proteins which forms the external boundary of the cytoplasm of a cell or surrounds a vacuole, and controls the channel of molecules in and out of the cytoplasm. Its function is to separate the substance of the cell from its outside environment and it controls what enters and exits the cell. Plasma membrane plays an essential role in protecting the integrity of the interior of the cell by allowing only selected substances into the cell and keeping other substances out.
